articles.title: Americans forfeit world junior hockey game against Switzerland after two COVID cases - Toronto Star
articles.description: If it’s anything like the way Omicron spread through the NHL after teams played each other, it could well damage the integrity of the tournament, scheduled to end Jan. 5.
articles.content:
EDMONTON After two cases of COVID-19, the defending champion United States was forced to forfeit Tuesday’s game against Switzerland at the world junior hockey championship in Red Deer, Alta.

articles.title: CDC shortens isolation for Covid-positive Americans to just 5 days - The Independent
articles.description: ‘We want to make sure there is a mechanism by which we can safely continue to keep society functioning while following the science,’ says CDC director Rochelle Walensky
articles.content:
Americans who test positive for the coronavirus can self-isolate for just five days, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention now says down from the 10 days the agency previously recommended.

articles.content:
